intro: Terminalia katikii, commonly known as the Katiki tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Combretaceae. It is native to tropical Africa, particularly found in countries like Nigeria and Cameroon. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a broad, rounded crown. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth surface, while the flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
